name: Central City Access Point
description: Compass Central City Access Point is one of three primary entry points in the city for families experiencing or at-risk of homelessness to connect with the San Francisco's Family Coordinated Entry. Services: - Problem solving and planning for finding safe shelter, whether with friends or family or by accessing emergency shelter - Intake and assessment for families who are unable to self-resolve their homelessness through problem solving - Screening for eligibility for shelter and housing program
fullDescription: Compass Central City Access Point is one of three primary entry points in the city for families experiencing or at-risk of homelessness to connect with the San Francisco's Family Coordinated Entry. whatTheyOffer: Compass Central City Access Point is one of three primary entry points in the city for families experiencing or at-risk of homelessness to connect with the San Francisco's Family Coordinated Entry. Services: - Problem solving and planning for finding safe shelter, whether with friends or family or by accessing emergency shelter - Intake and assessment for families who are unable to self-resolve their homelessness through problem solving - Screening for eligibility for shelter and housing program
howToGetIt: How to get connected: - In person: 37 Grove Street during operating hours to meet with an Access Point staff member for an eligibility assessment - By phone: Call us at 415-644-0504 and follow the instructions to be directed to Central City Access Point. Calls will be returned within two business days
keywords: i am experiencing homelessness and i need immediate help finding shelter.
i am experiencing homelessness (on the street, couchsurfing, or other) and i need long-term housing assistance.
